div3.p: 25 Handsome Building Lots in Buchanan's plan, on Clay, Marshall and Hancock streets, for Sale at Auction.--We will sell upon the premises, on Monday, the 20th day of October, commencing at 4 o'clock P. M., 25 handsome Building Lots in Buchanan's plan, as follows:

list.item: 1. Six lots in square No. 7 of said plan, fronting on the south side of Clay, between Norton and Kinney streets, 32 feet each, and running back 153 feet to a wide alley.
2. Ten lots in square No. 8 of said plan, fronting on the north side of Marshall, between Carrington and Kinney streets, 32 feet, and running back 153 feet to a wide alley.
3. Four lots in square No. 5, upon which is Buchanan's Spring, fronting on the south side of Clay, between Hancock and Harrison streets, 32 feet each, and running back 150 feet to an alley.

div3.p: Also, three lots in the same square, fronting on the west side of Hancock, between Clay and Marshall streets, 32 feet each, and running back as above.
These lots are beautifully located, and are worthy the attention of persons desiring to secure property for building purposes.
Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 4 and 8 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, and secured by trust deeds.
oc 13 Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.head: Six desirable Building Lots, on Valley or 17th street, at Auction.
div3.p:
--We will sell upon the promises, on Saturday, the 18th day of October, commencing at 4½ o'clock P. M., two very desirable Building Lots, in the northern portion of Adams's Valley.
They front 25 feet each, and run back 120 feet to Brown street.
After the sale of the above, will be sold four other Building Lots, in the immediate neighborhood.
Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 4 and 8 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed,
oc 13 Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.head: By Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.
div3.p:
Commodious Brick Dwelling-House for Sale.--Will be sold at auction on Monday, the 20th October, 1862, at 4½ o'clock P. M., that desirable private Dwelling, with eight or ten rooms above and three or four in the basement; kitchen, stable, smoke-house, and well of fine water; situation elevated, affording a fine view — retired, and yet convenient to business.
The lot fronts 45 feet on Pleasants street, opposite the residence and rural grounds of Dr. Strecker, and extends back 212 feet to a wide alley, on which it fronts 40 feet.

And, at the same time, the eligible Lot adjoining, on which is a large Hall, easily convertible into a neat cottage residence of five or six rooms, with other buildings; 35 feet front, 40 in rear, by 212 deep, with fruit and shade trees.
Also, will be sold a parcel of School Desks and Benches.

The sale of this property affords a fine opportunity to secure a large and pleasant residence, boarding-house, or school, in a good neighborhood; has now a good and punctual tenant, with whom, if desirable, arrangements may made in reference to possession.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at one and two years, for negotiable not as, interest payable half yearly, secured by a trust deed, or all cash, at the option of the purchaser.
oc 13 Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.

div3.head: Thirty to forty Handsome Lots in Sidney, in Harvie's plan, near Hollywood Cemetery, for Sale at Auction.
div3.p:
--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Tuesday, Oct, 21, 1862, at 4 o'clock P. M., from 30 to 40 Lots, in the plan of Lewis E. Harvie, Esq. Each lot has a front of about 60 feet, and a depth of about 140 feet to a wide alley.
They are located on Cherry, Laurel, Pine, and Belvidere streets, and are amongst the most beautiful and attractive lots in that very improving neighborhood.
A plat of the lots can be seen at our office.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed.
oc 11 Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.

div3.head: By Redwood & Keach, Auctioneers,
div3.p: [54 Main street.]

Large Sale of Furniture, Dry Goods, &c-- On Tuesday, October 14th, we will sell at our store, commencing at 10 o'clock, a large assortment of new and second-hand Furniture, Dry Goods, &c. We name in part--
Also, a large consignment of Dry Goods, &c., running the blockade, consisting of--
oc 13 Redwood & Keach, Aucts.

div3.head: By E. H. Stokes, Auct'r.
div3.p: Auction Sale.--We will sell at auction on Tuesday next, Oct. 14th, at 4 o'clock P. M., at our office on Cary st., three doors below 13th--

list.item: 1 medium size Herring's Safe, in perfect order.
3 or 4 cords kindling Wood, cut small.

div3.p: Sale conducted by E. H. Stokes, Auct.
oc 13

div3.head: By Richard Cauthorn, Auct.
div3.p:
Administrator's Sale of Clocks, Show-cases, Britannia Ware, &c. I shall sell on Tuesday morning, 14th inst., commencing at 10 o'clock, in rear of the store formerly occupied by the late T B. Humphreys, about thirty Clocks, embracing two fine Regulators, one very fine and handsome, suitable for an hotel, church, or office.
Also, Alabaster, Marble Ebony, and Mahogany Mantel Clocks; Britannia and Plated Castors and Tea Sets; I Bottom's Lathe; 1 Jeweller's do.; 1 Sign-Board, twelve feet in length; 2 German silver frame Show-Cases, seven feet in length, with single glass the entire length; 2 do., eight feet long, with two glasses in length; 2 do., four feet long, with single glass, extra deep; 1 large Mirror, six feet by four and a half. --Also, a lot of Watch Glasses.
T. F. Humphreys.
Adm'r of T. B. Humphreys, dec'd.
Sale conducted by R. Cauthorn. oc 13--2t

div3.head: By Sumner & Burress, Aucts.
div3.p: [Iron-Front Building, Governor street.]

Auction Sale of Manufactured Tobacco.--On Wednesday, the 15th inst., commencing at 10 o'clock, at our sales rooms, Governor street, we shall sell at auction 1,500 packages Manufactured Tobacco, in pounds, half pounds, twist, &c., consisting of Common, Medium, and Fine quality, a portion of which is of Extra Fine Henry and North Carolina brands of the best quality.
Also, Smoking Tobacco, in bulk, papers, bags, &c.
Cigars of assorted qualities, to which we invite the attention of buyers.
Samples will be ready for examination Tuesday afternoon. Sumner & Burress,
oc 13 Auctioneers.

div3.head: By Kent, Paine & Co., Auctioneers.
div3.p:
Groceries at Auction.--On Tuesday, the 14th instant, at 144 Cary street, we shall sell a large assortment of fine Groceries, with several invoices of fresh Drugs and Medicines, just received.
Kent, Paine & Co.,
oc 11 Auctioneers.

list.item: Will be added to the above--
40 bbls Coffee and fine Brown Sugar;

div3.p: oc 13 Kent, Paine & Co., Aucts.

div3.head: Dry Goods at Auction.
div3.p: --On Wednesday, the 15th instant, at the store recently occupied by Messrs. Ginter, Alvey & Arents, we shall sell, without reserve, several large invoices of Fancy and Staple Dry Goods, consisting in pare of--

list.item: 2,000 dozen Black and Colored Spool Cotton.

div3.p: oc 11 Kent, Paine & Co., Auct'rs.

div3.head: Coffee at Auction.
div3.p: --On Friday, the 17th instant, at our Warehouse, 166 and 165 Main street, we shall sell--
195 bags Rio Coffee.

The attention of the trade is invited to this important sale.
Samples ready for examination on the morning of the sale.
oc 11 Kent, Paine & Co., Auct'rs.

div3.head: Receiver's Sale.
div3.p: --By virtue of a decree of the District Court of the Confederate States for the Eastern District of Virginia, I shall sell, at Winnsville, in the county of Fluvanna, on Thursday, the 16th inst., at public auction, to the highest bidder, for cash, sundry articles of sequestrated property, consisting of Household and Kitchen Furniture, Farming Utensils, &c., &c.
Henry L. Brooke,
oc 6--tds Receiver of District No. 3.

div3.head: By Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.
div3.p:
Two desirable Farms, located in Chesterfield county, seven miles from Richmond, at Auction. --At the request of Rev. G. N. Winfree, we will sell upon the premises, on Tuesday, the 14th day of October, commencing at 12 o'clock M., two small Farms, located in the county of Chesterfield, about seven miles from Richmond, between the Richmond and Petersburg Railroad (three quarters of a mile therefrom) and the road to Chesterfield Court-House.
The first contains 250 acres of land, forty acres of which is cleared and highly improved; the balance is in woods.
The improvements consist of a Frame Dwelling, together with the usual outbuildings.
The locality is extremely healthy and attractive.
The second Farm, nearly adjoining, contains 200 acres, of which 75 are cleared and in cultivation; the remainder is heavily wooded.
The improvements consist of a Dwelling and the usual out-houses, together with a supply of excellent water.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added and secured by a trust deed.
div3.closer: oc 4 Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.head: Eight beautiful Building Lots on Elmwood, Dover and other streets, in Sidney, at Auction.
div3.p: --We will sell upon the premises, on Thursday, the 16th day of October, commencing at 5 o'clock P. M., five beautiful building lots located on the south side of the Westham Plank road, just above the residence of Charles Philips, Esq. They front 31 feet each, and run back 130 feet to an alley 10 feet wide.

Also, a lot fronting 200 feet on the north side of Dover street, between Laurel and Cherry, and running back 192 feet to an alley 20 feet wide.
It will be sold into lots of the usual size — say, six lots.
Also, a lot fronting 95 feet on the north side of Elmwood street, running back on Culvert street 125 feet to a wide alley.
Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 4 and 8 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
div3.closer: oc 7 Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.head: Valuable Suburban Farm, containing 13½ acres of Land, in the town of Sidney, on Harvie street, at Auction.
div3.p:
--We will sell upon the premises, on Thursday, the 16th day of October, commencing at 4½ o'clock P. M., a valuable suburban Farm located on Harvie street, in the town of Sidney, opposite to the residence of Mr. David Carter, and now in the occupancy of Mr. Henry Bohmer, containing 13½ acres of highly improved land.
The improvements consist of a brick dwelling, containing about six good rooms, and all necessary out-buildings, all of which are nearly new and in good order, together with a large garden and a young orchard of choice fruit trees.

This property is worthy the attention of persons seeking a home near the city of Richmond, as it has all the advantages of a country residence, with many conveniences of the city.
Possession will be given Feb. 1st, 1863.
Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
div3.closer: oc 6 Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.p:
A Valuable Farm, containing 319 Acres of Land, in Henrico county, six miles from Richmond, and within a half mile of the York River Railroad, at Auction.--At the request of Mr. George Turner, we will sell upon the premises, on Friday, the 17th day of October, commencing at 12 o'clock M., that valuable Farm lying in the county of Henrico, on the Williamsburg stage road, six miles from the city, and within a half mile of the York River Railroad.
It contains 319 acres of land, of which 150 acres are cleared and in a good state of cultivation; the remainder is in woods.--The improvements consist of two framed Houses, suitable for dwellings, together with the usual outbuildings, water, &c. The location is a very pleasant and healthy one.
Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
div3.closer: oc 7 Jas. M Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.head: Administrator's Sale of personal property.
div3.p: --As Administrator of William Gay, dec'd, I will sell at the residence of Mrs. E. Frasier, on Broad and 28th streets, on Saturday, the 18th day of October, commencing at 10 o'clock A. M., a lot of Household and Kitchen Furniture, consisting of the usual variety, together with two superior Milch Cows, &c.
div3.closer:
Geo, D. Pleasants,
oc 9--tds Adm'r of Wm. Gay, dec'd.
Sale conducted by J. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.p:
Administrator's Sale of 100 acres of Valuable Wood Land, on the Charles City road, seven miles below Richmond, together, with the Farming Implements, Stock, Household and Kitchen Furniture. --As administrator of Wm. Gay, dec'd, I will sell upon the premises, on Tuesday, the 21st day of October, commencing at 11 o'clock A. M., a tract of Land in the county of Henrico, near the Charles City road, and adjoining the lands of Thos. Lyne, Dr. Winfree, and others.
It contains 100 acres, and is very heavily wooded.
After the sale of the land, will be sold, at the late residence of Wm. Gay, adjoining the above tract, the entire Stock, Crops, Farming Implements, Corn, Fodder, &c.
Terms--Will be made known on the day of sale.
div3.closer:
Geo. D. Pleasants,
oc 9 Adm'r of Wm, Gay, dec'd.
Sale conducted by J. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.p: Four Handsome Vacant Lots on the South side of Jackson street, between 11th and 12th streets, French Garden Hill, for sale at suction.--We will sell upon the premises on Tuesday, the 21st day of October, commencing at 4½ o'clock, four handsome Building Lots, located on the South side of Jackson, between 11th and 12th streets, and adjoining the property of Mr. S. C. Robinson.
They front 33 feet each, and run back 110 feet.
Terms--One-half cash; the balance at 4 months for a negotiable notes with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
div3.closer: oc 11 Jas. M Taylor & Son, Aucts.

div3.head: The Valuable Farm known as "Marion Hill," half mile East of the city, for lease at Auction.
div3.p:
--I will sell at public auction, upon the premises, on Tuesday, the 21st day of October, commencing at 11 o'clock, A. M., the lease for one year, commencing from January 1st, 1863, of the valuable Farm located in Henrico county, half mile east of the city, and known as "Marion Hill," the late residence of W. F. Depriest, deceased.
The improvements consist of a large Brick Dwelling, together with all the usual out-buildings, a large orchard, and an abundance of water.
Possession for seeding Wheat will be given at once, and full possession on the 1st day of January next. Terms--At sale.
div3.closer:
Jno. A. Hutcheson, Receiver.
Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts. oc 11

div3.p: In Pursuance of A Decree of the District Court of the Eastern District of Virginia, pronounced on the 17th day of September, 1862, I shall, on Monday, the 20th day of October, commencing at 11 A. M., at the storehouse of W. S. Donnan, on East 13th, between Main and Franklin sts., proceed to sell, at public auction, a large and splendid assortment of Hardware and Cutlery, comprising, among other things, Shovels, Spades, Picks, Pokers, Shovels, Tongs, Scales, Meat-Cutters, Hinges, Locks, Sand Paper, Wrapping Paper, Shoe Brushes Bells, Table Knives, &c.

The particular attention of hardware merchants, saddlers, and others, is called to this sale.
The whole will be sold by catalogue, which will be ready for distribution by Thursday, the 9th inst.
Terms--Cash, in bankable funds.
div3.closer:
Thos. T. Giles, Receiver, &c.
As. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts. oc 4

div3.head:
By E. B. Cook.
Auctioneer.
div3.p: Tobacco Fixtures at Auction.--On Thursday, 16th instant, at 10 o'clock, I will sell at the store of G. W. Gretter, Esq., Main st., a large lot of Tobacco Fixtures, embracing--Tobacco Presses, Box Screws, Pot Mills, Flattening Mills and Blocks, of various sizes, Bands, and a variety of other fixtures for the manufacture of Tobacco.
The above are represented to be of the latest patterns, best quality and very little used.
The attention of tobacconists and others is particularly requested.
div3.closer:
E. B. Cook,
oc 6 Auctioneer.

div3.head: By W. S. Berry, Auctioneer.
div3.p: [Farmville, IVa.]

Sale of Land in the county of Buckingham.--I shall sell to the highest bidder, (if not sold privately before,) on Wednesday, the 22d day of October, 1862, my Tract of Land, lying in the county of Buckingham, seven miles above the town of Farmville, on the North side of Appomattox river, adjoining the lands of Col. P. W. Meredith, R. J. Gillespie, and others, containing 401 acres, by a former survey.
This land is in a high state of improvement, and suited to all the staple crops, especially wheat.
It has on it a comfortable dwelling-house and all other necessary houses, barns, &c.
Terms--Will be made to suit the purchaser.
I will take pleasure in shewing the land to any one wishing to purchase.
div3.closer:
John J. Lackland.
Sale conducted by W. S. Berry, Auctioneer.
oc 2--tds

div3.head: Public Sale of Valuable Mattaponiland.
div3.p:
--In pursuance of a decree of the Circuit Court of Caroline county, entered at its Sept. term last, in a case therein of Wright and Ala. vs.
Jesus and Ala., I shall, on Thursday, the 30th day of October, 1862, sell at public auction, to the highest bidder, on the premises, the valuable farm known as Aspen Hill the residence of the late Joseph Jesse, containing 1,205 acres, beautifully situated on the Mattaponi, with the Richmond, Fred'g and Potomac Railroad running through the centre of the farm, with the barns immediately on the railroad, one mile below Milford depot.
This farm is in the highest state of improvement, the dwelling large and convenient, with superior out-houses, all in excellent condition, situated in a refined and excellent neighborhood, three miles from Bowling Green, the county seat, at which place there are churches of different denominations.
This farm combines within itself all that convenience and comfort can desire.
Supposing any person desiring to purchase will examine the premises, a farther description is deemed unnecessary.

Terms For Sale.--One-third of the purchase money on or before the first day of January next, the remainder in two equal instalments, respectively payable on the first day of January, 1864 and 1865, but befiring interest from the 1st of Jan'y 1863. Burton B. Wright,
se 26--tds Commissioner.

div3.head: By Goddin & Apperson, Auctioneers.
div3.p:
Very Valuable and highly Productive Farm of 193 acres, in Henrico, on the new Central road, six miles below Richmond, for Sale at Auction, together with all the personal Effects thereon. --At the request of John H Mackenzie, Esq., (who is about to remove South,) We shall sell at public auction, on the premises, on Monday, the 20th of October, 1862, at 11 o'clock A. M., the valuable and highly productive Farm on which he now resides, adjoining the lands of Mr. Jacob S. Atlee and others, containing 193 acres, of which about 140 acres are cleared, and of which about 100 acres are now well set in herds grass and clover.
Twenty bushels of winter oats have been seeded, and the land is ready for seeding twenty bushels more.
There are three wells of water on the place, one of them within twenty feet of the dining-room; a good, young or chard, 100 grape vines, fine strawberry beds and asparagus beds, and the whole Farm is in fine order and under a good fence.
The buildings consist of an excellent Dwelling, containing seven rooms; kitchen, with four rooms smoke-house, dairy, work shop, large new barn, and stabling for eleven horses and six cows.

After the sale of the Farm, all the personal effects will be sold, correcting in part of six Horses, six Colts, six Cows, Sheep, Hogs, Farming Implements; also, one Manny Reaper, one new Montgomery Fan, &c.

Terms.--For the land, one-third cash; balance at one and two years, for bonds bearing interest, and secured by a trust deed, or all cash, at the option of the purchaser.
For the personal effects, terms made known at the hour of sale.
div3.closer: oc 11 Goddin & Apperson, Auct'rs.

div3.p:
Beautiful Suburban Farm, of 30 acres, near Mitchell's Spring, about three-quarters of a miles Northeast of Richmond, for sale at Auction.--At the request of William L. Cowardin, Esq., we shall sell at public auction, on the premises, on Tuesday, the 14th Oct, 1862, at 4½ o'clock P. M, his beautiful Cottage Residence, located as above.
The tract contains 30 acres, with a fine spring branch running through it. The improvements embrace a large dwelling, containing 9 rooms, with front, rear, and side porticos, besides large barn stable, carriage house, excellent horse power, kitchen, &c., with a well of pure water in the yard, and several excellent springs.
There will be sold with the dwelling 20 acres of land, and afterwards a lot of 10 acres, lying to the North of it. The place commands a fine view of Richmond, and is approached by an excellent road, recently made at great expense.
The land is in a high state of improvement, and is admirably adapted to vegetables.

Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 1 and 2 years, for bonds, bearing interest half yearly, secured by a trust deed, on all cash, at the option of the purchaser.
Goddin & Apperson,
oc 9 Auctioneers.

Large and well located Brick Dwelling and Vacant Lot attached, on Church Hill at the corner of 26th and Clay sts., for Sale at Auction.--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Wednesday, the 15th Oct, 1862, at 5 o'clock P. M., the large and very excellent brick dwelling located as above, now in the occupancy of Mr. A. W. Taylor.
The house has about eight rooms, wide passage, front and rear portico; large brick kitchen, and a well of fine water in the yard.
The lot has a front of 75 feet and a depth of 132 feet. It will be so divided as to sell with the dwelling 35 feet, and a vacant lot to the South, 40 feet by 132 feet.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at one and two years, for bonds bearing interest, (half yearly,) secured by a trust deed, or all cash, at the option of the purchaser.
div3.closer: oc 10 Goddin & Apperson, Auct's.

div3.p:
Valuable real Estate on Church Hill, at the Corner of 25TH and Leigh streets, for Sale at Auction.
At the request of Mr. Jas. M. Carter, (who having purchased a farm in Hanover, proposes to reside on it,) we shall sell at public auction, on Wednesday, the 15th of October, 1862, at four o'clock P. M., those two handsome brick tenements located as above, one in the occupancy of Mr. James A. Dismore, and the other now vacant — each having six rooms.
Also, the large and well arranged frame dwelling adjoining on the south, now occupied by Mr. Carter, containing six rooms, besides a kitchen and a well of fine water, and a large new brick stable.
Also, that truly beautiful lot at the corner of 25th and Leigh streets, fronting eighty-two and a half feet on the East side of 25th street, running back 132 feet. This lot is well set in fruit trees, grape vines, &c., and is very highly improved.
The other property is admirably well located.
Possession given in a short time.
The particular attention of these wanting neat dwelling-houses and handsome vacant lots, is respectfully called to this sale.
Terms. One-third cash; balance at six and twelve months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed, or all cash at the option of the purchase.
Possession of the residence, occupied by Mr. Carter, given in twenty days from day of sale, and of one of the brick tenements immediately.
div3.closer: oc 7 Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.

div3.p:
Valuable Farm of 189½ acres, in Hanover county, 12 miles Northeast of Richmond and three miles of Peake's Turnout, on the Virginia Central Railroad, for Sale at Auction.--At the request of Mr. Samuel S. Atkinson, we will offer for sale on Wednesday, 15th October, at 11 o'clock, the Farm on which he resides, located as above, adjoining the lands of Thos. Taliaferro, Ed. Pollard, and Fr. Wheat, containing 189½ acres, of which about 100 acres are cleared, and the balance in good timber.
The improvements consist of a good dwelling containing five rooms, kitchen, quarter, cow-house, carriage-house, &c.; a young peach orchard of choice fruit, and a well of good water in the yard.
The land lays well, and is adapted to vegetables, corn, wheat, &c.
Terms.--At sale.
div3.closer: oc 3 Goddin & Apperson, Auct'rs.

div3.p:
Administrator's Sale of A large amount of personal Estate, on the Brook Turnpike, one mile North of Richmond.
At the request of Benjamin Pollard, Jr., administrator of the late John Darracott, we shall sell at public auction, at the late residence of the decedent, on Thursday, the 16th Oct., 1862, at 10 o'clock A. M., all his personal effects, consisting of the Household Furniture, some of which is very good; 18 fat Hogs, 6 Sows, 30 Pigs; 24 head of Cattle, 17 of which are excellent Milch Cows; about 30 fine Sheep, 4 Horses, 4 Mules, Wheat Machine, Wheat Fan, Wheat Reaper, Carriage and Harness, all the Farming Utensils, lot of Wheat Straw, 1 four-horse Wagon, 1 small Wagon, &c., &c.
Terms.--All sums of $50 and under, cash; on all larger sums, a credit of four months.
div3.closer: oc 10 Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.

div3.head: Administrator's Sale of Slaves and personal Effects.
div3.p: --At the request of Mr. Wm. Moren, Administrator of Jacob Holloway, dec'd, we shall sell, at his late residence, on the plank-road, in Sidney, near the Westham House, on Thursday, the 16th of October, 1862, at 4 o'clock P. M., two negro men, aged 35 and 57 years, one Cow, and all the household Furniture belonging to the decedent.
Terms--Cash.
div3.closer: oc 6 Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.

div3.p:
Farm of 337 acres of Coal Land in Chesterfield county, 13 miles West of Richmond, and one mile from Coalfield Station, on the Richmond and Danville Railroad, for Sale at Auction.--At the request of Dr. Thomas J. Wooldridge, we shall sell at public auction, on the premises, on Friday, the 17th October, 1862, at 11 o'clock A. M. (if fair; if not, the next fair day,) his tract of Land located as above, called "Gilpin's." containing by recent survey 337 acres--of which about 30 acres are open land, the residue is heavily set in original and secondary growth, embracing a portion of very fine heart pine timber; and on that account, as well as the belief that it abounds in coal, is justly regarded very valuable.
The buildings consist of dwelling containing six rooms, and the usual out-houses, some what out of repair.
The land adjoins the Midlothian Pits and the lands of Messrs. Jas. R. McTyre, W. Goode, &c, and is believed to abound in coal.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at one and two years, for bonds bearing interest, secured by a trust deed, or all cash at the option of the purchaser.
A plat of the land can be seen at our office.
div3.closer: oc 8 Goddin & Apperson, Aucts.

div3.p:
Two very Valuable Lots, on Fifth and Marshall streets, for Sale at Auction.--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Saturday, the 18th October, 1862, at 4½ o'clock P. M., the valuable Lot on the west line of 5th street, adjoining Mr. Hutton's blacksmith's shop, fronting 25 feet, running back 110 feet, and having thereon a small wooden, building; also, the valuable Lot on the north side of Marshall street, adjoining on the west the grocery store of Mr. Barnes, fronting about 40 feet, running back 74 feet to an alley, and having thereon a brick kitchen and a framed carpenter's shop.
These Lots are well located for business purposes.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed.
div3.closer: oc 9 Goddin & Apperson. Aucts.

div3.p:
Farm of 318½ acres, in Henrico county, twelve miles above Richmond, near to Short Pump, for Sale at Auction.--On Tuesday, the 21st Oct, 1862, at 11 o'clock, (if fair; if not, the next fair day,) I shall offer for sale, on the premises, to the highest bidder, my farm, lying twelve miles above Richmond, in Henrico county, near the Deep Run Turnpike Road, adjoining the lands of Wm. McGruder, B. F. Bowles, and others, containing 318½ acres. The place will be divided, or added to, to suit a purchaser.
It has on it a good dwelling-house, with six rooms, and all other out-houses, in good repair, necessary for the place, a spring of most excellent water very near the house, and capital young orchard of apple and peach trees, with a variety of kinds.
The land is in a fine state of improvement, producing well any kinds of crops — tobacco, wheat, corn, oats, &c. It has on it also a great deal of most excellent meadow land and tobacco plant land, and could be made a very profitable farm to cattle drovers who reside in Western Virginia, being near enough to Richmond to make a good cattle stand.
Persons wishing to purchase are particularly invited to come and view the land, as many advantages not mentioned could be seen.
Society good, and it is convenient to many churches of different denominations.

Terms.--One-third cash; balance at six and twelve months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed.
T. C. Leake.
P. S.--Ap lat and survey will be exhibited at the hour.

Goddin & Apperson.
oc 7

div3.head: Dry Goods, Clothing, and Saddlery at Auction.
div3.p: --On Monday, the 13th instant, at 10 o'clock, I will sell, at my store, several invoices of Dry Goods, Clothing, Boots, Shoes, &c., comprising a great variety of fresh Goods suited to the present season.
Also, an invoice of Saddlery, containing Bridles, Stirrups, Saddles, Bits, Buckles, and, in fact, a great variety of Saddlers' materials — very scare and very much in demand.
div3.closer:
E. B. Cook,
oc 11 Auctioneer.

div3.head: Most Elegant and well kept Household and Kitchen Furniture at Auction.
div3.p: --I am authorized to sell, on Monday, 13th inst, commencing at 10 o'clock, at the late residence of Wm. F. Butler, Esq., (whose family has removed from the city,) corner of 12th and Marshall streets, his elegant and well kept Furniture, consisting in part of

list.item: Mahogany, Curled Maple, and Windsor Chairs;
Passage, 2-light, bronzed Gas Pendants and Brackets;
Wardrobes; best Curled Hair and other Mattresses Feather Beds, &c., &c.,

div3.p: Together with the usual supply of Kitchen and Laundry Furniture, amongst which is a superior Cooking-Stove, large, and but recently purchased.

The attention of those in want is particularly requested.
Terms. --Cash.
div3.closer: oc 7 E. B. Cook, Auct'r.

div3.head: By Goddin & Apperson, Auct's.
div3.p:
Excellent Brick Tenement and Vacant Lot adjoining, on the north side of Marshall, near to Brook Avenue, for Sale at Auction.--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Monday, 13th October, 1862, at 5 o'clk P. M., the excellent brick tenement located as above, now in the occupancy of Mr. A. A. Hutcheson.--The house has 7 rooms, with front and rear porticoes, and a brick kitchen and wood-house attached.
The lot has a front of 70 ft, and runs back to Brook Avenue, on which it has a greater front.
To the dwelling will be sold 33 feet, and to the vacant lot 37 feet.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed; or all cash at the option of the purchaser.

The foregoing real estate was sold at auction on the 19th September, 1862, and purchased by Mrs. Susannah D. Abernathy.
She having declined to comply with the terms of sale, the property will now be sold at her risk and costs.
div3.closer: oc 8 Goddin & Apperson, Auct's.

div3.p:
Five Hansom Brick Tenements, on the South side of Clay and East line of 7th streets, for Sale at Auction.--Will be sold at auction, on the premises, on Monday, the 13th of October, 1862, at 4 o'clock P. M., five of those six brick Tenements located as above, now occupied respectively by Mons, Paul, and Messrs. Doggett, Binford, Hill, and Mercer.
Each tenement has seven rooms, besides Kitchen, and is supplied with gas, water, and city culvert, and are very conveniently and neatly arranged.
They are located in a most desirable neighborhood.
Terms.--One-third cash; balance at 6 and 12 months, for negotiable notes, interest added, secured by a trust deed, or all cash at the option of the purchasers.
div3.closer:
Goddin & Apperson,
oc 7 Auctioneers.

div3.head: By James M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.
div3.p:
Valuable Farm in the county of Henrico, 15 miles east of Richmond, at Auction.--At the request of Dr. Poindexter, we will sell upon the premises, on Monday, the 13th day of October, commencing at 12 o'clock M. the valuable Farm located in the county of Henrico, 15 miles East of Richmond, within 3 miles of James river, and lately occupied by him. It contains 681 acres of land, of which 425 acres are cleared, and in a high state of cultivation; the remainder is heavily wooded with pine and oak of virgin growth.
The improvements consist of a two-story framed Dwelling, containing seven large rooms, together with a Kitchen, Negro Quarters, Smoke-House, Stable, Barn, Ice House, and every other out- building needed upon a plantation.
There is also upon the farm an abundance of marl, easy of access.
Possession can be had at once.
Terms.--One-third cash; the balance at 1 and 2 years, for negotiable notes, with interest added, and secured by a trust deed.
oc 4 Jas. M. Taylor & Son, Aucts.
After the sale of the Farm will be sold all the Farming Implements, consisting in part of one Wheat Fan, one Threshing Machine, one Cob crusher, Carts, Wagons, &c., &c. oc 11

On Monday, the 13th inst., at 10 o'clock, I will sell at the residence of Mr. Charles Petzer, on Brook Avenue, near Bacon Quarter Branch, all his Furniture, consisting in part of elegant Sofas, Charis, Marble-top Table, Brussels Carnets, fine Engravings, splendid Clock.
Chamber Furniture.--Mahogany, Jenny Lind, and other Bedsteads, Bureaus, Washstands, Wardrobes, Cane seat Chairs, Feather Beds, Mattresses, Lounges, &c.

Dining-Room Furniture.--Extension Tables, Oak Chairs, Safe, Side Tables, China, Crockery, and Glassware.
The kitchen Furniture comprises the usual variety, amongst which is an excellent Cooking Stove.
Alexander Nott,
oc 11 Auctioneer.

The above sale is postponed until further notice.
[oc 13] A. N., Auct.

div3.head: Valuable Farm in the county of Henrico at Auction.
div3.p:
--I will sell, upon the premises, on Monday, the 13th day of October, commencing at 1 o'clock, the valuable farm located in the county of Henrico, 14 miles east Richmond, and within three miles of James river adjoining the lands of Dr. Poindexter, Cornell Crew, and James Binford, containing two hundred and fourteen acres; of which one hundred acres are cleared and in a high state of cultivation; the remainder is heavily wooded with oak and pine.
The improvements consist of a good frame building, with five rooms, passage, and good dry basement, together with a good kitchen, smoke-house stable, barn, corn house, carriage-house, &c., besides a plenty of good water upon the land; also may be found, an abundance of marl.
Person wishing to buy will find it to their interest to attend the sale.
Terms.--Made known upon the day of sale.
C. C. Gatheright.

P. S.--Any one desiring to purchase the above farm, and wishing to ascertain anything in regard to it, can see me at my residence, corner of 29th, and Grace streets.
[oc 7--6t] C. C. G.

div3.head:
Navy Department C. S.,
Office of Sup't Coal Contracts,
Richmond, Oct. 11th, 1862.
div3.p: Proposals for Coal.--Sealed Proposals, to be endorsed "Proposals for Coal," and to be addressed to this office, will be received until 12 o'clock, Tuesday, October 21st 1862, for the delivery of two thousand (2,000) tons of Coal in Richmond, as follows, viz:

row.cell: At the Navy-Yard, for use of steamers
At the Navy-Yard, for use of shops

div3.p: The Coal for use of steamers to be lump, and free from sulphur, iron, and other impurities; that for the use of workshops may be the "run of the mine."

Proposals must state the quality of the Coal, and the price per ton, of twenty-two hundred and forty (2,240) pounds each, and the highest rate of delivery per month till the whole quantity is delivered.
The first delivery must be, if possible, on or before the 1st of November next, and the whole quantity bid for must be delivered by the 1st of November, 1863, or sooner.
Samples of one hogshead from each bidder to be furnished at the "Shockoe Works," that the Coal may be tested.

Proposals will be received for furnishing the whole of 2,000 tons, or for each lot, as expressed above, and the Coal will be subject to the inspection and approval of the agents of the Navy Department. Ten (10) per cent, of the amount of payment for each delivery to be reserved till the completion of the contract.
div3.closer:
John K. Mitchell,
Superintendent of Coal Contracts.
oc 11--[02]

figure.figDesc: Page image of Daily Dispatch, Volume 23, Number 87, page 4.

div3.head: Atlanta Markets.
div3.p: --Under date of October 7, the Confederacy furnishes the following:

Last week our grocery market was unusually active in the sale of some articles — especially in the early part of the week.--There was a speculative demand for cotton years, osnaburgs, shirting, sheetings, &c., at continually advancing prices during the whole week.
Sugar and flour very dull of sale, at our quotations.
Salt is in great demand at advanced prices, mostly Virginia salt in the market; stock light.
Tobacco dull sale at previous quotations.

Common to good sugar, 40@42; fair to fully fair, 43@45; prime to choice, 45 @48; yellow clarified 50@52; while clarified 55@58.
Stock moderate, demand light.
Molasses $2.25 per gallon.
Superfine flour in barrels $30; Extra Family $30@32.
Stock moderate, demand light.
Wheat $5@$6 per bushel.
Virginia salt $62½ per sack by the car load; $65@75 in small quantities.
Liverpool salt $125@130 per sack.
Tallow candles in demand at $1@1.25 per lb. Tobacco 40@$1.25 per pound. --Stock heavy — demand moderate.
Osnaburgs, 72½@75 cents per yard, 7/8 shirting, 62½ cents per yard; 4.4 sheeting, 70@72½ cents per yard; cotton yarns, $7.75@$8 per bunch.

McCall, democrat, Pennsylvania; Brigadier-General Ebenezer Dumont, republican, Indiana; Brigadier General John A. Garfield, republican, Ohio; Colonel DeWitt C. Littlejohn, republican, New York; Colonel W. F. Gresham, republican. Indiana; Colonel James Gavin, republican, Indiana; Colonel Elijah McCarty, republican, Illinois; Colonel Wm. R. Morrison, democrat, Illinois; Colonel Amassa Cobb, republican, Wisconsin; Colonel John T. Farnsworth, republican, Illinois; Major Joel B. Warner, democrat, Pennsylvania.

my 23--ts Richmond, Va.

div3.head: Artificial Teeth--the Cheoplastic and Vulcanite Process.
div3.p:
--G. W. Jones, Dentist, having the right for the above mode of making Teeth, and being satisfied of its absolute superiority over all other methods, can with confidence commend it to those desiring full or partial sets of teeth, and especially such as may be dissatisfied with those they are now using.
The perfect adaptation of the plate to the mouth, and the suction thereby secured, enables him to insert one or more teeth without clasps. This method having been adopted by those standing highest in the profession, North and South, testimonials will be given and specimens exhibited to those wishing to see them.
Sets of Teeth, on gold or any other plate, will, of course, be made for those preferring them.
Filling, Cleansing, Extracting, and all other operations, gently and thoroughly performed.
Teeth extracted by Electricity, without pain.
Office on Main street, opposite Corinthian

div3.head: Deceased soldiers' Claims.
div3.p:
--Claims for supplies and every other description of claim against the Government will be attended to by the subscriber.
A long and intimate acquaintance with such business justifies him in saying that, when entrusted to his care, they will be prosecuted to an early and successful settlement.
Correspondents will receive prompt replies to their letters, consulting him on business.
His fees, except by special agreement, will be 10 per cent. on amounts collected.
Remittances of the same will be made by checks from the banks, or otherwise, if ordered.

soldiers' Claims.--"The claiming heir must produce his or her affidavit, and that of one disinterested person, stating the relationship and that there is no other person entitled to claim.
For instance, if the claimant be a mother, the affidavit must state there is living neither wife, child, nor father of the deceased; if the father, that there is neither wife nor child; and if the child, that there is no wife. The magistrate administering the oath should certify to the credibility of the witness, and the clerk of the court should certify, under the seal, that he is such magistrate."

Claims prepared in accordance with the above, (accompanied by an order signed by the claimant, and witnessed by two witnesses, authorizing the amount due to be paid,) and transmitted by mail to the undersigned, will be sufficient.
Where the claimant is present in the city, upon application to the undersigned all the papers necessary for procuring the pay, &c. due deceased or discharged soldiers, will be prepared, ready for presentation to the proper office, for a fee of $1, or he will prosecute and obtain the pay on the same at a reasonable charge.

He takes the liberty of referring to the gentlemen named below for testimonials of character, &c.:
Rev Dr M D Hoge, Richmond.
Rev Samuel T Moorman, Richmond.
Hon P Clayton, of Ga, Ass't Sec'y of the Treasury, Richmond.
Hon Wm Smith, Col 49th Reg't Va Vols.
M Blair, Esq, Commission Merchant, Richmond.
Hon John B Clark, Senator, Mo.
Hon John Goode, M C, Va.
Hon John W Crockett, M C, Ky.
Hon W Ewing, M C, Ky.
Hon W W Avery, Morganton, N C.

And the members generally of the Virginia Legislature.
Ed W D M. Clark,
No. 3, first floor Law Buildings, adjoining

au 20--eod1m* Whig office, Richmond.
Va.
